SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.percussion.cms.objectstore
Class PSObjectPermissions

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSObjectPermissions
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSFolderPermissions
public abstract class PSObjectPermissions
extends Object

This class contains all the logic for determining the level of access a user has on a specified object. The level of access can be determined by using either of the following:


1> Credentials of the user making the request and the security specified on the securable object being accessed. This will typically be used on the server, which will then create an access mask and associate it with the securable object.


2> Using the access mask set on the securable object. This will typically be used on the client side. The client will use the access mask set on the securable object by the server.


This class basically encapsulates an access mask. This access mask determines all the permissions a particular user has on a specified securable object. The encapsulated access mask cannot be modified once set (in the constructor). This class has been made abstract. The derived classes need to override the abstract methods processAcl() and processAclEntry() Typically a new derived class will be created for a specific type of securable object. For example, PSFolderPermissions class represents permissions on folder objects.

ACCESS_ALL

public static final int ACCESS_ALL

Constant Field Values

m_permissions

protected int m_permissions
Access mask for storing all the permissions a particular user has on a securable object, initialized in the constructor, never modified after initialization. Defaults to deny access to everyone.

m_objectAcl

protected PSObjectAcl m_objectAcl
Contains the set of permissions specified on the securable object (such as Folders), may be null if single arg constructor is used, otherwise initialized in the constructor, never modified after initializartion.

m_userInfo

protected com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSUserInfo m_userInfo
Contains the credentials of the user accessing the securable object, may be null if single arg constructor is used, otherwise initialized in the constructor, never modified after initialization.

m_accessLevel

protected int m_accessLevel
server access level for the user, initialized to which implies no access to the server, set in the two arg constructor

Constructor Detail

PSObjectPermissions

protected PSObjectPermissions(IPSRequestContext request)
                       throws PSAuthorizationException,
                              PSCmsException
This constructor will typically be used on the server side. This sets the user's server access level based on the credentials in the request object.

Parameters:
request - request context information, may not be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if request is null
PSCmsException - if request to server to get the user info fails for any reason
PSAuthorizationException - if any error occurs getting the user's server access level

PSObjectPermissions

protected PSObjectPermissions(int permissions)
This constructor will typically be used on the client side (generally using the access mask set on the securable object by the server). This just stores the specified access mask.

Parameters:
permissions - the access mask to encapsulate, should be non-negative
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if permissions is invalid
Method Detail

init

protected void init(PSObjectAcl objectAcl)
This method does the actual work of determining the user's permissions on the object using the specified ACL and the user's information. This creates the encapsulated access mask using the user credentials contained in the request context object (passed as an argument to the ctor) and permissions set on the securable object using the specified objectAcl

Parameters:
objectAcl - contains the set of permissions specified on the securable object (such as Folders), may not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if objectAcl is null

getUserServerAccessLevel

protected int getUserServerAccessLevel()
Get the server access level for the user.

Returns:
the user's access level

processAcl

protected abstract boolean processAcl()
Abstract method to be overwritten by derived classes. This method is called before the ACL entries are processed. This method will always be called even if the ACL contains no ACL entry.

Returns:
true to process the ACL entries, false otherwise. If false is returned then processAclEntry will never be called.

processAclEntry

protected abstract boolean processAclEntry(com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSObjectAclEntry aclEntry)
Abstract method to be overwritten by derived classes. This method is guaranteed to be called at least once if processAcl() returns true, otherwise this is never called. If process() method returns true then this method is called once for each ACL entry in the ACL. After all the ACL entries have been processed it is called once with null value for aclEntry. If the ACL does not contain any ACL entry then this is called only once with null value for aclEntry.

Parameters:
aclEntry - the ACL entry currently being processed, is null for the last call made to this method while processing the ACLs, otherwise never null
Returns:
true if the ACL entry processing should continue

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Compares the specified object with this object. Returns true if the reference to this object itself is specified. Returns false if the specified object is not an instance of this class.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
obj - the object with which this object should be compared, may not be null
Returns:
true if the specified object is an instance of this class and represents the same permissions on the securable object. Returns false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if obj is null

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns the hashcode of this object. This simply returns the permissions set on the securable object.

Overrides:
hashCode in class Object
Returns:
the hashcode of this object, always non-negative

getPermissions

public int getPermissions()
Returns the encapsulated access mask which indicates all the permissions a particular user has on a specified securable object. This access mask can then be used in the hasAccess(int) method to determine if a particular type of access is allowed or not.

Returns:
an access mask which has the corresponding bit set if a particular permission is granted, and the bit turned off if the permission is denied

hasAccess

public boolean hasAccess(int accessLevel)
Returns true if the encapsulated access mask allows the desired level of access, false otherwise.

Parameters:
accessLevel - the desired level of access, must be one of the following: PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_DENY PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_READ PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_WRITE PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_ADMIN PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_SERVER_ADMIN_STR
Returns:
true if the encapsulated accessMask has the bit set corresponding to the permission specified by desiredAcess, false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if accessLevel is invalid

translateAccess

public static String translateAccess(int accessLevel)
Translates integer based access level to the string based access level.

Parameters:
accessLevel - must be one of the following predefined levels of access PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_DENY PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_READ PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_WRITE PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_ADMIN PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_SERVER_ADMIN
Returns:
string based access level, never null or empty
Throws:
IllegaArgumentException - if accessLevel is invalid

translateAccess

public static int translateAccess(String accessLevel)
Translates string based access level to the integer based access level.

Parameters:
accessLevel - must be one of the following predefined levels of access PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_DENY_STR PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_READ_STR PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_WRITE_STR PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_ADMIN_STR PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_SERVER_ADMIN_STR May not be null or empty
Returns:
integer based access level
Throws:
IllegaArgumentException - if accessLevel is invalid

getHigherAccessLevel

public static int getHigherAccessLevel(int accessLevel)
Gets the next higher level of access than the specified access level. For example, if accessLevel equals ACCESS_DENY then ACCESS_READ is returned, accessLevel equals ACCESS_READ then ACCESS_WRITE is returned, accessLevel equals ACCESS_WRITE then ACCESS_ADMIN is returned, accessLevel equals ACCESS_ADMIN then ACCESS_SERVER_ADMIN is returned, accessLevel equals ACCESS_SERVER_ADMIN then ACCESS_SERVER_ADMIN itself is returned,

Parameters:
accessLevel - the access level whose next higher access level is to be returned, must be valid access level
Returns:
the next higher level of access as described above.
Throws:
IllegaArgumentException - if accessLevel is invalid

hasNoAccess

public boolean hasNoAccess()
Convenience method that calls hasAccess(ACCESS_DENY)

hasReadAccess

public boolean hasReadAccess()
Convenience method that calls hasAccess(ACCESS_READ)

hasWriteAccess

public boolean hasWriteAccess()
Convenience method that calls hasAccess(ACCESS_WRITE)

hasAdminAccess

public boolean hasAdminAccess()
Convenience method that calls hasAccess(ACCESS_ADMIN)

hasServerAdminAccess

public boolean hasServerAdminAccess()
Convenience method that calls hasAccess(ACCESS_SERVER_ADMIN)

validateAccessLevel

protected static void validateAccessLevel(int accessLevel)
Validates that the access level is one of the following: PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_DENY PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_READ PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_WRITE PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_ADMIN PSObjectPermissions.ACCESS_SERVER_ADMIN_STR

Parameters:
accessLevel - specifies the level of access, should be non-negative and a valid access level.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if accessLevel is invalid
